revised_title: Electromotive Changes in the Mammalian Spinal Cord following Electrical Excitation of the Cortex Cerebri
tldr: The authors investigate the electromotive changes in the mammalian spinal cord following electrical excitation of the cortex cerebri. They use a sensitive Lippmann's capillary electrometer to detect the changes and find that the mammalian nerve shows a marked demarcation current and a small quick movement of the mercury following the application of a single stimulus. The results provide insights into the relationship between the cortex and the spinal cord in the production of epileptic convulsions.
